_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four kinds of mindfulness meditation: Meditating observing the body internally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish
Meditating observing the body externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish
Meditating observing the body internally and externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish
Meditating observing feelings internally … externally … internally and externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish
Meditating observing the mind internally … externally … internally and externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish
Meditating observing principles internally … externally … internally and externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish
Meditating perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive
Meditating perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive
Meditating perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive and the repulsive
Meditating perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive and the unrepulsive
Meditating staying equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive
Meditating staying equanimous, mindful and aware, ignoring both the repulsive and the unrepulsive
